---
id: capture-screenshot
title: Capture a screenshot
---

import Tabs from '@theme/Tabs';
import TabItem from '@theme/TabItem';
import CodeBlock from '@theme/CodeBlock';

import PuppeteerPageScreenshotSource from '!!raw-loader!./puppeteer_page_screenshot.js';
import PuppeteerApifySnapshotSource from '!!raw-loader!./puppeteer_apify_snapshot.js';
import PuppeteerCrawlerPageScreenshotSource from '!!raw-loader!./puppeteer_crawler_page_screenshot.js';
import PuppeteerCrawlerApifySnapshotSource from '!!raw-loader!./puppeteer_crawler_apify_snapshot.js';

:::info
To run this example on the Apify Platform, select the `apify/actor-node-puppeteer-chrome` image for your Dockerfile.
:::

This example captures a screenshot of a web page using `Puppeteer`. It would look almost exactly the same with `Playwright`.

<Tabs>
<TabItem value="pagescreenshot" label="PageScreenshot" default>

Using `page.screenshot()`:

<CodeBlock className="language-js">
	{PuppeteerPageScreenshotSource}
</CodeBlock>

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="apifysnapshot" label="ApifySnapshot" default>

Using `Apify.utils.puppeteer.saveSnapshot()`:

<CodeBlock className="language-js">
	{PuppeteerApifySnapshotSource}
</CodeBlock>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

This example captures a screenshot of multiple web pages when using `PuppeteerCrawler`:

<Tabs>
<TabItem value="pagescreenshot" label="PageScreenshot" default>

Using `page.screenshot()`:

<CodeBlock className="language-js">
	{PuppeteerCrawlerPageScreenshotSource}
</CodeBlock>

</TabItem>

<TabItem value="apifysnapshot" label="ApifySnapshot" default>

Using `Apify.utils.puppeteer.saveSnapshot()`:

<CodeBlock className="language-js">
	{PuppeteerCrawlerApifySnapshotSource}
</CodeBlock>

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

In both examples using `page.screenshot()`, a `key` variable is created based on the URL of the web page.
 This variable is used as the key when saving each screenshot into a key-value store.
